questions.prompt: A 2000×2000 matrix has 12,000 non-zero entries. What is the sparsity percentage?

options: Each node connects to only a few other nodes via elements
Engineers design circuits to have sparse matrices
Sparse matrices are easier to visualize
questions.correctAnswer: Each node connects to only a few other nodes via elements
questions.explanation: Each circuit element (R, C, etc.) connects only 2-3 nodes. So each node has non-zero entries only for its neighbors, not all n nodes.
questions.prompt: Why are circuit matrices typically sparse?

options: Adding artificial entries to balance the matrix
New non-zero entries created during LU factorization
The process of storing zeros efficiently
Filling empty rows with default values
questions.correctAnswer: New non-zero entries created during LU factorization
questions.explanation: Fill-in refers to matrix positions that were zero in the original matrix but become non-zero during LU factorization.
